intro: Dendrophthoe pauciflora, commonly known as the sparse-flowered mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on a variety of host trees. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and is characterized by its leafless stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant relies on its host for water and nutrients, while performing photosynthesis to some extent. Its small, white or pale green flowers are typically arranged in clusters and are pollinated by insects. Dendrophthoe pauciflora is found in tropical and subtropical regions, often in forested areas where its host trees thrive.
